divs: sighting detailssighting report: this siting happened many years ago, and i have been telling it to family members, but never knew where to go to log an "official" report that may be of some use to someone. im now 36, this siting happened when i was 14 (1983). it was very early in the moring, id estimate the time to be 4:15 am or so, it was pre-dawn or so, with no lightening happening on the horizon. i think it was early spring - it was cool - but not mitten-cold, and it was mostly clear, with just a few "scuttle" clouds around. i was on my morning paper route. i was delivering papers on coe street, in woonsocket ri, near the intersection of coe and providence street, and was delivering papers to the houses across the street from the holy family church rectory. there is a big parking lot associated with the church. i heard a low rumbling, similar to an idling 18-wheeler. i was convinced there was an 18-wheeler nearby idling, and being a cautious young lady, i remember looking at the parking lot to see the truck and why they might be hanging around, and not seeing one, glancing up and down the street looking for it. this is when i noticed a dull orange glow hitting the street from where i was standing to about 70 feet down from me, towards the intersection of providence street. the glow was similar to that cast by high intensity sodium lighting, but with a stronger orange hue. the glow immediately had me looking up, where to my utter surprise, i found the source of the low rumbling sound. a large "craft" of some sort was moving very slowly over the street. it was rectangular in shape, and i can only explain it as a massive lumbering barge kind of thing. i wouldnt begin to guess on size, because i couldnt judge how high it was, but it was def. higher than the rectory building - and it pretty much was obliterating the view of the sky over the road from my perspective - when i saw it, it was almost directy overhead. the bottomside of the ship - the only portion i could see - had dozens of circular orange lights - the same color as vehicle parking lights - in a regular grid pattern along its entire width and length the spaces between the lights were in dark shadow and i could make no other detail other than its rectangular shape amongst the dark blue pre-dawn sky. it was one solid unit. it was moving very slow, and i got the sickening sense that it was scanning the ground below. i was suddenly aware that i was possibly in the orange glow, and was terrified of the prospect that i might have been seen by any occupants on that thing. i remember dropping my bike, and running to the nearest home, where i stood, hyperventilating, in thier screened porch, as the thing lumbered over the road in front of the house. i remember dogs in the home barking excitedly. i remember the glass panes in the house windows and door begin to audibly vibrate\resonate from the low frequency rumbling of that thing. i stood frozen with fear in that porch for what seemed like an eternity, but was probably more like a couple of minutes. i remember wondering if i should start banging on the door of the house and wake the people inside up. before i decided upon an action however, the rumbling quickly faded, the glow on the street vanished. after a few more minutes, when i had calmed down, and the dogs stopped barking, i left the porch and scanned the sky - as much of it as i could see from the front of my hiding place on the porch. i could not see the object anywhere. i still had the rest of my paper route to finish, which i did with record-breaking speed, and i was glad when the sky started to lighten up with early morning colors! im most curious to know, if anyone else has ever reported similar craft anywhere else, and how often, and if there had been additional information - any contact with the crew of the craft? could this be some kind of military craft? this does not fit the description of the usually stealthy quiet white saucers people report, and i know what transport helicopters look like. please please respond (rachellandry@cox.net) - what this thing might have been has been haunting me for years. thank you
trends: There have been 10 other sightings in Woonsocket
There were no other sightings in Woonsocket on or around February 25th 2005
